entry.title: Flora Mae Hunter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the cooking of Flora Mae Hunter (pictured) was enjoyed so much by the Duchess of Windsor that she gained weight on her visits to the plantation where Hunter worked?

entry.title: pronoun avoidance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in Indonesian, a language featuring pronoun avoidance, a common polite way to address someone else is "father" or "mother", instead of "you"?

entry.title: Gottfried Hornik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gottfried Hornik, a baritone at the Vienna State Opera for 25 years, appeared in his signature role of Beckmesser from Aachen and Barcelona in 1976 to the Municipal Theatre of Santiago in 2001?

entry.title: Beaux-Arts Apartments (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Beaux-Arts Apartments never went into foreclosure despite being completed at the start of the Great Depression?

entry.title: The Fifth Doll (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charlie N. Holmberg's idea for The Fifth Doll began with a writing exercise to develop a system of magic for a household item?

entry.title: PMA (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the All Time Low song "PMA" features guest vocals from Heather Baron-Gracie of the British band Pale Waves?

entry.title: Song Kok Hoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Song Kok Hoo was the first Asian deputy commissioner of police in Singapore?

entry.title: Schloss Gripsholm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Schloss Gripsholm was dedicated by author Kurt Tucholsky to a license plate number?
